alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Fairfield; Lexington; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 30 at 4:39PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following areas, Calhoun, Central Orangeburg, Chesterfield, Clarendon, Fairfield, Kershaw, Lee, Lexington, Northern Lancaster, Northwestern Orangeburg, Richland, Southeastern Orangeburg, Southern Lancaster and Sumter. * WHEN...Through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A band of heavy rain will continue across the Midlands through this evening. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible. Rainfall totals will range from 2 to 5 inches with locally higher amounts possible. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
